title: Calories in 1 lb of Ground Beef
meta_description: Discover calories in 1lb of ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100g, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in 1 lb of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, pan-broiled (cooked), drained of excess fat; 1 lb ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, draining, and brand; raw vs. cooked weights differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 lb of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1117 kcal and ~109 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp oil for cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 lb cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1117 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 lb ground beef?
Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—90% lean has fewer calories (~200 kcal/100 g) than 80% lean.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked; raw has lower calories per gram but cooking reduces weight by ~25% due to fat/water loss.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 1 lb 80% lean ground beef?
faqs.a: About 77 g total fat, including 32 g saturated.
